intro: Leandra micrantha, commonly known as the small-flowered leandra, is a species of flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Melastomataceae and is characterized by its attractive, small, showy flowers that typically bloom in clusters. The plant has opposite, ovate leaves that are often covered in a fine pubescence, giving it a soft texture. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in the understory of tropical forests. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
